news.title: The phone is dead. Long live . . . what exactly?
news.summary: "We're not going to be using iPhones in 10 years," Callaghan says flatly. "I kind of don't think we'll be using them in five years."

news.title: Almost 80 European deep tech university spinouts reached $1B valuations or $100M in revenue in 2025
news.summary: According to Dealroom’s European Spinout Report 2025, 76 European deep tech and life sciences spinouts have either reached $1 billion valuations, $100 million in revenue, or both.

news.title: 12 investors dish on what 2026 will bring for climate tech
news.summary: After a tumultuous year, venture investors are still optimistic about climate tech's long-term prospects, especially as data centers continue to drive demand for electricity, manufacturing, and materials.

news.title: The best AI-powered dictation apps of 2025
news.summary: AI-powered dictation apps are useful for replying to emails, taking notes, and even coding through your voice

news.title: VCs predict enterprises will spend more on AI in 2026 — through fewer vendors
news.summary: Enterprises have been experimenting with AI tools for a few years. Investors predict they will start to pick winners in 2026.

news.title: Two cybersecurity employees plead guilty to carrying out ransomware attacks
news.summary: Two former employees at cybersecurity firms - one of whom was a ransomware negotiator - have pleaded guilty to carrying out a series of ransomware attacks in 2023. news.title: The OneXSugar Wallet is the first gaming handheld with a folding screen
news.summary: Folding OLED displays are still most commonly found on premium smartphones and laptops, but One-Netbook is bringing the tech to a new gaming device. news.title: Anker’s portable backup battery is an even better investment now that it’s nearly half off
news.summary: Winter storms across the country are bringing heavy snow, rain, and — in some cases, as this Californian who briefly lost power a few days ago can attest — outages. news.title: The FCC has probably killed a plan to improve smart home security
news.summary: The US Cyber Trust Mark Program, an Energy Star-style certification for smart home security, could be winding down less than a year after it launched. news.title: The science of how (and when) we decide to speak out—or self-censor
news.summary: The study's main takeaway: "Be bold. It is the thing that slows down authoritarian creep."

news.title: Lawsuit over Trump rejecting medical research grants is settled
news.summary: Settlement forces NIH to review grants previously rejected on ideological grounds.

news.title: DOGE did not find $2T in fraud, but that doesn’t matter, Musk allies say
news.summary: Musk allies spin DOGE as having a "higher purpose" beyond federal budget cuts.

news.title: NJ’s answer to flooding: it has bought out and demolished 1,200 properties
news.summary: The state deals with flooding and sea level rise by buying homes in flood prone areas.

news.summary: Netflix's finale will also have a two-day theatrical release to more than 600 locations.

news.title: The Best Over-the-Counter Sleep Aids (2025), Tested and Reviewed
news.summary: I tested an array of alternative sleep aids, from gummies to wearable patches, to see if they would help my chronic insomnia.

news.title: Poor Sleep Quality Accelerates Brain Aging
news.summary: Research shows that people who sleep poorly tend to have brain age that is older than their actual age. Chronic inflammation in the body caused by poor sleep likely plays a part.

news.title: AI-Powered Dating Is All Hype. IRL Cruising Is the Future
news.summary: Dating apps and AI companies have been touting bot wingmen for months. But the future might just be good old-fashioned meet-cutes.

news.title: Fears Mount That US Federal Cybersecurity Is Stagnating—or Worse
news.summary: Government staffing cuts and instability, including this year’s prolonged shutdown, could be hindering US digital defense and creating vulnerabilities.

news.title: Discovering the Dimensions of a New Cold War
news.summary: The United States’ plan for dealing with Putin’s Russia and Xi’s China remains ill-defined among a shifting global order. That must change.
